quotes.text: A man is what he thinks about all day long·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Nothing is more simple than greatness; indeed, to be simple is to be great·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Every next level of your life will demand a different you.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Beware what you set your heart upon· For it surely shall be yours·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes·
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.text: Don’t be pushed by your problems· Be led by your dreams·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: The scariest moment is always just before you start·
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.text: Little by little, one travels far·
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.text: Dare to live the life you have dreamed for yourself· Go forward and make your dreams come true·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be·
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.text: Do that which is assigned you, and you cannot hope too much or dare too much·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Paths are made by walking·
quotes.author: Franz Kafka

quotes.text: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Be silly· Be honest· Be kind·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Learn to sell. Learn to build. If you can do both, you will be unstoppable·
quotes.author: Naval Ravikant

quotes.text: The only person you are destined to become is the person you decide to be·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: We walk alone in the world· Friends, such as we desire, are dreams and fables·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Without ambition one starts nothing· Without work one finishes nothing· The prize will not be sent to you· You have to win it·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Better to know a few things which are good and necessary than many things which are useless and mediocre·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: It will be the toughest thing you’ll ever do, but your heart is never wrong·
quotes.author: Maxime Lagacé

quotes.text: Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer·
quotes.author: Dan Brown

quotes.text: Our strength grows out of our weakness·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: Every artist was first an amateur·
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.text: If you are free, you need to free somebody else. If you have some power, then your job is to empower somebody else·
quotes.author: Toni Morrison

quotes.text: Individuals search for truth, groups search for consensus·
quotes.author: Naval Ravikant

quotes.text: If you are not willing to risk the unusual, you will have to settle for the ordinary·
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.text: Understand: you are one of a kind. Your character traits are a kind of chemical mix that will never be repeated in history. There are ideas unique to you, a specific rhythm and perspective that are your strengths, not your weaknesses. You must not be afraid of your uniqueness·
quotes.author: Robert Greene

quotes.text: Our greatest strength lies not in never having fallen, but in rising every time we fall·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: To laugh often and much; To win the respect of intelligent people and the affection of children; To earn the appreciation of honest critics and endure the betrayal of false friends; To appreciate beauty, to find the best in others; To leave the world a bit better, whether by a healthy child, a garden patch or a redeemed social condition; To know even one life has breathed easier because you have lived· This is to have succeeded·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Life is a journey, not a destination·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Unless you try to do something beyond what you have already mastered, you will never grow·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Build a better mousetrap, and the world will beat a path to your door·
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.text: Never confuse a single defeat with a final defeat·
quotes.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quotes.text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better·
quotes.author: Samuel Beckett

quotes.text: A ship is always safe ashore but that is not what it’s built for·
quotes.author: Albert Einsteint

quotes.text: Not all those who wander are lost·
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken·
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.text: Resist much, obey little·
quotes.author: Walt Whitman

quotes.text: They can because they think they can·
quotes.author: Virgil

quotes.text: Obstacles are the cost of greatness·
quotes.author: Robin Sharm

quotes.text: Take your time, play the long game, embrace the boring, the difficulties, the uncomfortable. This is how it will happen·
quotes.author: Maxime Lagacé
